decks.notes: The key concept of the deck is to maintain control of the game by using a combination of powerful creatures and versatile spells. The deck focuses on generating value through cards like Delighted Halfling, Omnath, Locus of Creation, and Solitude. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats. Leyline Binding provides additional control elements by shutting down opponent's spells and abilities. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Wrenn and Six and Teferi, Time Raveler to further control the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure access to all necessary colors of mana.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total to take advantage of the powerful Death's Shadow creature. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Grief, and Dauthi Voidwalker, you can disrupt your opponent's hand and graveyard while also fueling your own strategy. Additionally, cards like Terminate, Lightning Bolt, and Fatal Push provide removal options to control the board and clear a path for your aggressive creatures. The deck also includes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Not Dead After All to generate additional value through card advantage and resilience.

The key concept of this deck is to use the combination of Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to generate massive amounts of mana and play multiple lands per turn. This allows the player to quickly ramp up their resources and search for specific powerful lands or win conditions like Urza's Saga and The One Ring. The deck also utilizes various lands with unique abilities, such as Boseiju, Who Endures and Mirrorpool, to provide additional advantages and flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its explosive mana generation and high-value plays.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of cards to cycle through the deck quickly, cascade into Living End, and then cast it for free from the graveyard, bringing back a wide variety of creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards like Grief and Subtlety to disrupt the opponent's strategy, as well as cards like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves to further enhance the cycling theme. The inclusion of force of negation provides additional control elements, while cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Misty Rainforest offer mana fixing and consistency.

This deck is focused on the synergy between lands and artifacts to enable the Amulet Titan combo. The key concept revolves around utilizing the Amulet of Vigor and cards like Arboreal Grazer and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to accelerate mana and enable powerful plays. Primeval Titan is a crucial piece of the combo, allowing for the search and play of lands like Urza's Saga, Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, and Tolaria West. This deck aims to generate a significant amount of mana and play powerful spells quickly, overwhelming the opponent with its explosive combos.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using the Amulet of Vigor card to gain extra mana and untap lands whenever a permanent enters the battlefield. This allows the player to quickly ramp up their mana and accelerate their game plan. The deck synergizes with cards like Arboreal Grazer, Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, and Primeval Titan to search for and play lands, generating even more mana and potentially overwhelming the opponent with a powerful board state. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Urza's Saga and Tolaria West to search for important combo pieces and gain card advantage.

The deck focuses on aggressive play and quick damage output with a mix of creatures and spells. The key concept revolves around using efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Orcish Bowmasters to deal early damage, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Dauthi Voidwalker and Thoughtseize. Grief and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker are used to further disrupt the opponent's hand and board state. The deck includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats, and has some graveyard synergies with Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Undying Evil. The land base emphasizes a mix of black and red sources for consistent mana.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to aggressively apply pressure on the opponent's life total by quickly deploying efficient threats. This is achieved through a combination of disruptive elements like Dauthi Voidwalker, Grief, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, and powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Orcish Bowmasters to quickly deal damage. The deck also includes removal spells such as Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Terminate to deal with opposing threats, while utilizing Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Not Dead After All to maintain card advantage and resilience.

This deck focuses on the strategy of using cascade to gain an advantage in tempo and card advantage. By casting spells with cascade, such as Violent Outburst, players can often cast multiple spells in a single turn while also getting additional free spells from their deck. The deck utilizes various cards with cascade, such as Shardless Agent and Crashing Footfalls, to overwhelm the opponent with creatures and spells. It also includes disruption and removal spells like Dead / Gone and Force of Negation to control the game and protect its own board state.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and explosively play multiple spells for free using the Cascade mechanic. This is achieved by playing cheap cascade spells like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst, which will then trigger cards like Crashing Footfalls and Lórien Revealed, allowing the player to flood the board with powerful creatures and gain a substantial advantage. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety to protect the player's strategy, while also utilizing removal spells like Dead / Gone and Dismember to deal with opposing threats.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay and utilizing the Cascade mechanic. The key concept is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap cascading spells and creatures. With cards like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst, you can cast spells for free while also triggering powerful cascade effects. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Negation and Subtlety to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, Murktide Regent adds a strong threat to the board, while Tishana's Tidebinder provides utility and Dead / Gone offers removal options. The mana base includes various lands to support the deck's color requirements.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Cascade mechanic to its fullest potential, casting spells for free or at a reduced cost while also adding additional value to the board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Shardless Agent, Murktide Regent, and Tishana's Tidebinder, while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Negation and Subtlety. The inclusion of Crashing Footfalls provides a constant stream of free creatures, putting pressure on the opponent to keep up. The land base is built to support the deck's color requirements and provide utility with cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Gemstone Caverns.

This deck focuses on using the Cascade mechanic to generate value and aggressive board presence. It looks to cast low-cost Cascade spells like Violent Outburst and Crashing Footfalls to put creatures into play for free. The deck includes cards like Tishana's Tidebinder, Shardless Agent, and Murktide Regent to provide strong threats. It also has disruptive elements with cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation to counter opposing spells. The deck utilizes a mix of lands, including fetch lands like Misty Rainforest and interaction lands like Otawara, Soaring City, to ensure consistent mana and optimize its game plan.

This deck aims to utilize a toolbox of creatures to create a combo strategy. The key concept revolves around using Chord of Calling and Eldritch Evolution to search for specific creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide. These creatures provide powerful effects, such as sacrificing and manipulating counters, which can be used to generate value and control the board. The deck also includes various utility creatures and lands to support the combo strategy and ensure consistency. Overall, the main goal is to assemble the right combination of creatures to execute a winning combo.

The key concept of this deck is to use the card Indomitable Creativity to manipulate the battlefield and create huge advantageous swings in your favor. By sacrificing your smaller creatures or even Leyline Binding, you can exile them to create large threats like Archon of Cruelty. The deck also includes cards like Transmogrify and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to further support this combo strategy. The deck also includes various removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending, as well as disruption cards like Spell Pierce and Teferi, Time Raveler to help protect and enable the combo.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using the cards Colossus Hammer and Puresteel Paladin. Ornithopter and Esper Sentinel provide early game presence, while Stoneforge Mystic searches for the necessary equipment. The deck also includes cards like Giver of Runes and Shadowspear for protection and removal. The Reality Chip and Kaldra Compleat provide additional powerful threats. The deck utilizes cards like Urza's Saga and Sigarda's Aid to enhance its efficiency. It includes counterspells like Spell Pierce and Surge of Salvation for disruption. Overall, the deck aims to quickly set up the Colossus Hammer combo for a devastating attack.

This deck focuses on aggressive playstyle by utilizing a mix of 4/5 colors. The key concept revolves around utilizing the companion, Jegantha, the Wellspring, to provide an additional resource for the deck. The deck takes advantage of creatures with low mana costs, such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Wild Nacatl, Nishoba Brawler, Territorial Kavu, and Scion of Draco. The deck also includes a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and counterspells like Stubborn Denial to control the board. Tribal Flames adds additional damage potential, while Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide stability and protection. The deck utilizes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana base.

This deck revolves around the combo of Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan. By playing Amulet of Vigor, you can untap your lands whenever you play a land. This allows you to quickly generate large amounts of mana and play Primeval Titan, which can search for and put into play important lands like Urza's Saga, Boseiju, Who Endures, and Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion. These lands provide additional value and help set up win conditions. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Azusa, Lost but Seeking to ramp up your mana production even further.

The key concept of this deck is utilizing the combo potential of Amulet Titan to ramp up mana quickly and enable explosive plays. The deck includes cards like Primeval Titan, Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, and Arboreal Grazer to accelerate the mana production. Amulet of Vigor synergizes with land enters-the-battlefield abilities, allowing for multiple activations of lands like Simic Growth Chamber and Gruul Turf. The deck also includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Tolaria West to search for key pieces. The goal is to assemble the necessary combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with big, game-ending plays.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana and play multiple lands per turn using cards like Arboreal Grazer, Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, and Azusa, Lost but Seeking. This allows the player to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus. The deck utilizes cards like The One Ring and Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate even more mana. The deck also includes cards like Summoner's Pact and Urza's Saga to search for specific cards and create powerful land-based combos. Overall, the deck focuses on rapidly ramping and finding key pieces to create a combo with high mana output.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Cascade mechanic to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent. By casting cards like Violent Outburst and Shardless Agent with Cascade, the deck can generate additional value and field presence for minimal mana cost. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Subtlety and Force of Negation to hinder the opponent's strategies. The inclusion of Crashing Footfalls allows for the deck to flood the board with powerful, hasty creatures. Overall, the deck aims to quickly cascade into powerful spells and creatures to maintain a constant pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Cascade mechanic to constantly generate value and overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures. By running cards like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst, the deck aims to cascade into powerful spells like Crashing Footfalls and Lórien Revealed, allowing for massive board presence and damage output. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Subtlety and Leyline of the Guildpact to hinder the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana base and options for different colors of spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive tactics by utilizing the Cascade mechanic. The main strategy is to play low-cost creatures such as Shardless Agent and Scion of Draco while also taking advantage of Cascade spells like Violent Outburst and Crashing Footfalls. The deck includes elements of control with cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's plans. It also features a combination of land types to ensure access to various colors and has Leyline cards to boost the effectiveness of spells. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with a combination of creatures and spells.

The key concept of this deck revolves around utilizing the Cascade mechanic to quickly deploy threats and disrupt opponents. By combining Aggro elements with Cascade cards like Shardless Agent, Violent Outburst, and Lórien Revealed, the deck can cast additional spells for free, increasing the board presence and overwhelming the opponent. Additionally, cards like Murktide Regent and Tishana's Tidebinder provide additional threats and disruption, while Force of Negation helps protect the game plan. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Dead / Gone and Dismember, as well as versatile cards like Subtlety and Fire / Ice for added flexibility.

The main concept of this deck is to combo off using Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and a variety of creatures that have valuable abilities. The deck utilizes a "toolbox" approach, meaning it has a wide range of creatures that can be searched for and played as needed. The deck aims to control the board and generate advantage by sacrificing and recurring creatures, dealing damage, and gaining life. It also includes cards like Chord of Calling to search for specific creatures and improve consistency. The deck includes a mix of lands to support the deck's strategies.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the combination of Indomitable Creativity and Leyline Binding to quickly and efficiently generate powerful threats on the battlefield. By exiling Leyline Binding and other cheap artifacts/enchantments, the deck can use Indomitable Creativity to create larger threats like Archon of Cruelty and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The deck also includes cards like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending for removal, while Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption and card advantage. The land base includes fetch lands for consistency and access to multiple colors of mana.

The key concept of this deck is to create a powerful combo utilizing the interaction between Heliod, Sun-Crowned and various creatures that enter the battlefield. By using creatures like Thraben Inspector, Rangers-Captain of Eos, and Wall of Omens, the deck is able to generate card advantage and continually trigger Heliod's ability to place counters on creatures. This allows for the creation of an army of indestructible creatures, which can be further enhanced with cards like Ephemerate and Agatha's Soul Cauldron. The deck also includes control elements like Silence to disrupt opponents' strategies.

This deck revolves around the combo of casting Living End to essentially wipe the board of creatures and bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard. The key concept is to use cycling cards such as Architects of Will, Curator of Mysteries, and Street Wraith to cycle through your deck and fill your graveyard with creatures. Then, using cascading spells like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst, you can cast Living End from your hand and return all the creatures from your graveyard to the battlefield. Force of Negation is included for protection, while the mana base supports the deck's color requirements.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of cycling cards, cascade effects, and the Living End spell to create powerful board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on cycling through the deck quickly to set up for a massive cascade into Living End, which will then bring back all creatures from both players' graveyards. It also includes disruptive elements such as Force of Negation to protect its strategy and control the opponent's moves. The land base is designed to provide the necessary mana requirements for the deck's spells and abilities.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the power of Merfolk creatures to create an aggressive and controlling strategy. The deck features various Merfolk lords such as Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost the power and toughness of other Merfolk. Additionally, cards like Merfolk Trickster and Tishana's Tidebinder provide control elements by tapping or freezing opposing creatures. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Rishadan Dockhand to disrupt opponent's strategies. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures onto the battlefield and Force of Negation provides additional protection. The deck also includes some removal spells like Path to Exile for creature removal. The land base consists of various lands that can produce blue and white mana to support the deck's mana requirements.

This deck revolves around the central card, "The One Ring", which serves as a focal point for control strategies. The main objective is to maintain board control and disruption through cards like Supreme Verdict, Lórien Revealed, Subtlety, and Solitude. The deck also features powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to further control the game and limit opponents' resources. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. Kaheera, the Orphanguard acts as a companion to provide additional support and value.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost and efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Murktide Regent. It also incorporates disruptive elements with cards like Subtlety and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to control the board. To ensure consistency, it includes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Preordain for card selection. The mana base consists of various fetch lands and dual lands to ensure smooth mana production. Overall, it aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disrupt their plans.
